evidence: The ambitious work is Roy’s first novel, and it won the Booker Prize . The God of Small Things is set in Kerala in the 1960s, and it follows matriarch Ammu’s family through both ordinary and tragic events, focusing most memorably on her “two-egg twins,” Estha and Rahel. The accidental death by drowning of a visiting English cousin has a pivotal effect on their young lives. The novel is told in nonlinear time through a jigsaw of vivid encounters and descriptions, recounted in exquisite prose.
